register.description:
Description Register.
This register provides IP module ID, revision information, instance index and standard MMR registers offset.

bitfield.description: Module identifier used to uniquely identify this IP.

Standard IP MMR block offset. Standard IP MMRs are the set of from aggregated IRQ registers till DTB. 0: Standard IP MMRs do not exist 0x1-0xF: Standard IP MMRs begin at offset of (64*STDIPOFF from the base IP address)
NOTE: This IP does not have DTB as part of the Standard IP MMRs. It uses DTBCTL instead.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Major revision of IP (0-15).
Minor revision of IP (0-15).

register.description:
Interrupt mask.
This register selects interrupt sources which are allowed to pass from RIS to MIS when the corresponding bit-fields are set to 1.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

32kHz TICK to RTC and WDT.
Either derived from selected LFCLK or generated from CLKULL in absence of LFCLK.

LFINC filter gearing restart.
Indicates that the LFINC filter restarted gearing. Subsequent LFINC estimates may have higher variation.

HFXT Amplitude compensation - settled
Indicates that the amplitude compensation FSM has reached the SETTLED or TCXOMODE state, and the controls configured in HFXTTARG or HFXTDYN are reached.

HFXT Amplitude compensation - controls at target
Indicates that the control values configured in HFXTTARG or HFXTDYN are reached. Applies to Q1CAP, Q2CAP and IREF.

Pre-LF clock edge detect.
Indicates that a positive edge occured on the selected pre-LF clock LFCLKSEL.PRE. Can be used by software to confirm that a LF clock source is running and within the expected frequency, before selecting it as the main LF clock source.

LF clock is lost.
Indicates that no LF clock edge occured for ~49us (~1.6 times nominal period). The system will automatically fall-back to generating LFTICK based on CLKULL, to avoid timing corruption. Note that this signal is NOT related to the analog LF clock-loss detector which can reset the device during STANDBY.

LF clock period out-of-range.
Indicates that a LF clock period was measured to be out-of-range, according to LFQUALCTL.MAXERR.

LF clock good.
Indicates that the LF clock is good, according to the configuration in LFQUALCTL.

LFINC updated.
Indicates that a new LFINC measurement value is available in LFCLKSTAT.LFINC.

TDC done event.
Indicates that the TDC measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC PEAK measurement update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC PEAK measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC BIAS measurement update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC BIAS measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC comparison update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC comparison is done.

Out-of-range indication from the tracking loop.
Indicates that the selected reference clock frequency of the tracking loop is out-of-range.

Clock loss indication from the tracking loop.
Indicates that the selected reference clock of the tracking loop is lost.
HFXT amplitude good indication.

HFXT fault indication.
Indicates that HFXT did not start correctly, or its frequency is too low. HFXT will not recover from this fault and has to be restarted. This is only a one-time check at HFXT startup.

HFXT good indication.
Indicates that HFXT started correctly. The frequency is not necessarily good enough for radio operation. This is only a one-time check at HFXT startup.

register.description:
Raw interrupt status.
This register reflects the state of all pending interrupts, regardless of masking. This register allows the user to implement a poll scheme. A flag set in this register can be cleared by writing 1 to the corresponding ICLR register bit.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Note that this signal is NOT related to the analog LF clock-loss detector which can reset the device during STANDBY.

LF clock good.
Indicates that the LF clock is good, according to the configuration in LFQUALCTL.

TDC done event.
Indicates that the TDC measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC PEAK measurement update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC PEAK measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC BIAS measurement update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC BIAS measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC comparison update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC comparison is done.

Out-of-range indication from the tracking loop.
Indicates that the selected reference clock frequency of the tracking loop is out-of-range.

Clock loss indication from the tracking loop.
Indicates that the selected reference clock of the tracking loop is lost.
HFXT amplitude good indication.

HFXT fault indication.
Indicates that HFXT did not start correctly, or its frequency is too low. HFXT will not recover from this fault and has to be restarted. This is only a one-time check at HFXT startup.

HFXT good indication.
Indicates that HFXT started correctly. The frequency is not necessarily good enough for radio operation. This is only a one-time check at HFXT startup.

register.description:
Masked interrupt status.
This register is simply a bitwise AND of the contents of IMASK and RIS.*] registers. A flag set in this register can be cleared by writing 1 to the corresponding ICLR register bit.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description:
Interrupt set register.
This register can used by software for diagnostics and safety checking purposes. Writing a 1 to a bit in this register will set the event and the corresponding RIS bit also gets set. If the corresponding IMASK bit is set, then the corresponding MIS register bit also gets set.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

32kHz TICK to RTC and WDT.
Either derived from selected LFCLK or generated from CLKULL in absence of LFCLK.

LFINC filter gearing restart.
Indicates that the LFINC filter restarted gearing. Subsequent LFINC estimates may have higher variation.

HFXT Amplitude compensation - settled
Indicates that the amplitude compensation FSM has reached the SETTLED or TCXOMODE state, and the controls configured in HFXTTARG or HFXTDYN are reached.

HFXT Amplitude compensation - controls at target
Indicates that the control values configured in HFXTTARG.Q1CAP, HFXTTARG.Q2CAP and HFXTTARG.IREF or HFXTDYN.Q1CAP, HFXTDYN.Q2CAP and HFXTDYN.IREF are reached.

Pre-LF clock edge detect.
Indicates that a positive edge occured on the selected pre-LF clock LFCLKSEL.PRE. Can be used by software to confirm that a LF clock source is running and within the expected frequency, before selecting it as the main LF clock source.

LF clock is lost.
Indicates that no LF clock edge occured for ~49us (~1.6 times nominal period). The system will automatically fall-back to generating LFTICK based on CLKULL, to avoid timing corruption. Note that this signal is NOT related to the analog LF clock-loss detector which can reset the device during STANDBY.

Indicates that a LF clock period was measured to be out-of-range, according to LFQUALCTL.MAXERR.

LF clock good.
Indicates that the LF clock is good, according to the configuration in LFQUALCTL.

LFINC updated.
Indicates that a new LFINC measurement value is available in LFCLKSTAT.LFINC.

TDC done event.
Indicates that the TDC measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC PEAK measurement update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC PEAK measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC BIAS measurement update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC BIAS measurement is done.

HFXT-ADC comparison update event.
Indicates that the HFXT-ADC comparison is done.

Indicates that the selected reference clock frequency of the tracking loop is out-of-range.

Clock loss indication from the tracking loop.
Indicates that the selected reference clock of the tracking loop is lost.
HFXT amplitude good indication.

HFXT good indication.
Indicates that HFXT started correctly. The frequency is not necessarily good enough for radio operation. This is only a one-time check at HFXT startup.

register.description:
Interrupt clear register.
This register allows software to clear interrupts. Writing a 1 to a bit in this register will clear the event and the corresponding RIS bit also gets cleared. If the corresponding IMASK bit is set, then the corresponding MIS register bit also gets cleared.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitenum.token: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
bitenum.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitenum.token: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
bitenum.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.description: High frequency crystal control

bitfield.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Skip potentially unstable clock cycles after enabling HFXT. Number of cycles skipped is 8*QUALDLY.

Temperature compensated crystal oscillator mode.
Set this bit if a TXCO is connected.

Type of temperature compensated crystal used.
Only has effect if TCXOMODE is set.

bitenum.token: Use with CMOS TCXO
bitenum.description: Use with CMOS TCXO

bitenum.token: Use with clipped-sine TCXO
bitenum.description: Use with clipped-sine TCXO

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

High performance clock buffer enable.
This bit controls the clock output for the RF PLL. It is required for radio operation.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.description: Low frequency oscillator control

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
LFOSC enable

register.description: Low frequency crystal control

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Leakage compensation control

bitenum.token: No leakage compensation
bitenum.description: No leakage compensation

bitenum.token: Half leakage compensation
bitenum.description: Half leakage compensation

bitenum.token: Full leakage compensation
bitenum.description: Full leakage compensation

bitfield.description: Control the BIAS current of the input amp in LP buffer

bitenum.token: Maximum bias current: 50nA
bitenum.description: Maximum bias current: 50nA

bitenum.token: Minimum bias current: 25nA
bitenum.description: Minimum bias current: 25nA

bitfield.description: Adjust current mirror ratio into oscillator core. This value is depending on crystal and is set by FW. This field uses a 2's complement encoding.

Boost oscillator amplitude
This value depends on the crystal and needs to be configured by Firmware.

Regulation loop bias resistor value
This value depends on the crystal and needs to be configured by Firmware.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Control the buffer used. In normal operation, low-power buffer is used in all device modes. The high-performance buffer is only used for test purposes.
Amplitude regulation mode

bitenum.token: Amplitude control loop disabled
bitenum.description: Amplitude control loop disabled

bitenum.token: Amplitude control loop enabled
bitenum.description: Amplitude control loop enabled

bitfield.description: LFXT enable

register.description: Low frequency clock qualification control

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Maximum LFCLK period error.
Value given in microseconds, 3 integer bits + 3 fractional bits.

Number of consecutive times the LFCLK period error has to be smaller than MAXERR to be considered "good". Setting this value to 0 will bypass clock qualification, and the "good" indicator will always be 1.

register.description: Low frequency time increment control

bitfield.description: Controls if the LFINC filter prevents STANBY entry until settled.

bitenum.token: Enable. Prevent STANDBY entry.
bitenum.description: Enable. Prevent STANDBY entry.

bitenum.token: Disable. Do not prevent STANDBY entry.
bitenum.description: Disable. Do not prevent STANDBY entry.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Integral part of the LFINC filter.
This value is updated by Hardware to reflect the current state of the filter. It can also be written to change the current state.
Controls the final gear of the LFINC filter.

bitenum.token: Highest final gear. Best dynamic frequency tracking, but higher variation in filter value.
bitenum.description: Highest final gear. Best dynamic frequency tracking, but higher variation in filter value.

bitenum.token: Lowest final gear. Best settling, but less dynamic frequency tracking.
bitenum.description: Lowest final gear. Best settling, but less dynamic frequency tracking.

bitfield.description:
Controls the threshold for gearing restart of the LFINC filter.
Only effective if GEARRSTRT is not ONETHR or TWOTHR.

bitenum.token: Restart gearing on small error. Potentially more false restarts, faster response on small frequency shifts.
bitenum.description: Restart gearing on small error. Potentially more false restarts, faster response on small frequency shifts.

bitenum.token: Middle value towards SMALL.
bitenum.description: Middle value towards SMALL.

bitenum.token: Middle value towards LARGE.
bitenum.description: Middle value towards LARGE.

bitenum.token: Restart gearing on large error. Fewer false restarts, slower response on small frequency shifts.
bitenum.description: Restart gearing on large error. Fewer false restarts, slower response on small frequency shifts.

bitfield.description: Controls gearing restart of the LFINC filter.

bitenum.token: Restart gearing when the error accumulator crosses the threshold twice in a row.
bitenum.description: Restart gearing when the error accumulator crosses the threshold twice in a row.

bitenum.token: Restart gearing when the error accumulator crosses the threshold once.
bitenum.description: Restart gearing when the error accumulator crosses the threshold once.

bitenum.token: Never restart gearing. Very stable filter value, but very slow response on frequency changes.
bitenum.description: Never restart gearing. Very stable filter value, but very slow response on frequency changes.

bitfield.description:
Use a higher gear after re-enabling / wakeup.
The filter will require 16-24 LFCLK periods to settle (depending on STOPGEAR), but may respond faster to frequency changes during STANDBY.

bitenum.token: Use soft gearing restarts
bitenum.description: Use soft gearing restarts

bitenum.token: Don't use soft gearing restarts
bitenum.description: Don't use soft gearing restarts

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description: Low frequency time increment override control

bitfield.description:
Override LF increment
Use the value provided in LFINC instead of the value calculated by Hardware.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

LF increment value
This value is used when OVERRIDE is set to 1. Otherwise the value is calculated automatically.

register.description: High frequency tracking loop control

bitfield.description: Enable tracking loop.
Bypass Delta-Sigma-Modulation of fine trim.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Select the reference clock for the tracking loop. Change only while the tracking loop is disabled.

bitenum.token: Select GPI as reference clock.
bitenum.description: Select GPI as reference clock.

bitenum.token: Select LRF reference clock.
bitenum.description: Select LRF reference clock.

bitenum.token: Select HFXT as reference clock.
bitenum.description: Select HFXT as reference clock.

bitfield.description:
Reference clock ratio.
RATIO = 24MHz / (2*reference-frequency) * 2^24 Commonly used reference clock frequencies are provided as enumerations.

bitenum.token: Use for 4MHz reference clock
bitenum.description: Use for 4MHz reference clock

bitenum.token: Use for 8MHz reference clock
bitenum.description: Use for 8MHz reference clock

bitenum.token: Use for 48MHz reference clock
bitenum.description: Use for 48MHz reference clock

Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.description: Nanoamp-bias control

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Enable nanoamp-bias

register.description: Low-frequency clock-monitor control

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Enable LFMONITOR. Enable only after a LF clock source has been selected, enabled and is stable. If LFMONITOR detects a clock loss, the system will be reset.

register.description: Low frequency clock selection

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Select low frequency clock source for the PRELFCLK interrupt.
Can be used by Software to confirm that the clock is running and it's frequency is good, before selecting it in MAIN.

bitenum.token: External LF clock through GPI.
bitenum.description: External LF clock through GPI.

bitenum.token: Low frequency crystal oscillator
bitenum.description: Low frequency crystal oscillator

bitenum.token: Low frequency on-chip oscillator
bitenum.description: Low frequency on-chip oscillator

bitenum.token: No clock. Output will be tied low.
bitenum.description: No clock. Output will be tied low.

bitfield.description:
Select the main low frequency clock source.
If running, this clock will be used to generate LFTICK and as CLKULL during STANDBY. If not running, LFTICK will be generated from HFOSC and STANDBY entry will be prevented.

bitenum.token: External LF clock through GPI.
bitenum.description: External LF clock through GPI.

bitenum.token: Low frequency crystal oscillator
bitenum.description: Low frequency crystal oscillator

bitenum.token: Low frequency on-chip oscillator
bitenum.description: Low frequency on-chip oscillator

bitenum.token: No LF clock selected. LFTICK will be generated from HFOSC, STANDBY entry will be prevented.
bitenum.description: No LF clock selected. LFTICK will be generated from HFOSC, STANDBY entry will be prevented.

register.description: ADC clock selection

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Select ADC clock source
Change only while ADC is disabled.

bitenum.token: 48MHz HFXT
bitenum.description: 48MHz HFXT

bitenum.token: 48MHz CLKSVT
bitenum.description: 48MHz CLKSVT

register.description: Low-frequency clock status

bitfield.description:
Low frequency clock good
Note: This is only a coarse frequency check based on LFQUALCTL. The clock may not be accurate enough for timing purposes.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
LFINC filter is running and settled.
Source of LFTICK.

bitenum.token: LFTICK generated from CLKULL (LFCLK not available)
bitenum.description: LFTICK generated from CLKULL (LFCLK not available)

bitenum.token: LFTICK generated from the selected LFCLK
bitenum.description: LFTICK generated from the selected LFCLK

bitfield.description:
Source of LFINC used by the RTC.
This value depends on LFINCOVR.OVERRIDE, LF clock availability, HF tracking loop status and the device state (ACTIVE/STANDBY).

bitenum.token: Using FAKE LFTICKs with corresponding LFINC value.
bitenum.description: Using FAKE LFTICKs with corresponding LFINC value.

bitenum.token: Using override value from LFINCOVR.LFINC
bitenum.description: Using override value from LFINCOVR.LFINC

bitenum.token: Using filtered / average value. This value is updated by hardware and can be read and updated in LFINCCTL.INT.
bitenum.description: Using filtered / average value. This value is updated by hardware and can be read and updated in LFINCCTL.INT.

bitenum.token: Using measured value. This value is updated by hardware and can be read from LFINC.
bitenum.description: Using measured value. This value is updated by hardware and can be read from LFINC.

bitfield.description:
Measured value of LFINC.
Given in microseconds with 16 fractional bits. This value is calculated by Hardware. It is the LFCLK period according to CLKULL cycles.

register.description: HFXT status information

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

HFXT startup time
Can be used by software to plan starting HFXT ahead in time. Measured whenever HFXT is enabled in CLKULL periods (24MHz), from HFXTCTL.EN until the clock is good for radio operation (amplitude compensation is settled).
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

HFXT clock fault
Indicates a lower than expected HFXT frequency. HFXT will not recover from this fault, disabling and re-enabling HFXT is required.

HFXT clock available.
The frequency is not necessarily good enough for radio operation.

register.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.description: HFOSC tracking loop status information

bitfield.description:
Current HFOSC tracking error valid
This bit is one if the tracking loop is running and the error value is valid.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Current HFOSC tracking error
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Current HFOSC Fine-trim value
This field uses the internal fractional representation (sign, 4 integer bits, 8 fractional bits). The actual trim value applied to the oscillator is delta-sigma modulated 5 bits non-signed (inverted sign bit + integer bits).

register.description: HFXT Amplitude Compensation Status

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Current AMPCOMP FSM state.

bitenum.description: First shutdown state

bitenum.token: Amplitude down correction

bitenum.token: Initial amplitude ramping with HFXTINIT values
bitenum.description: Initial amplitude ramping with HFXTINIT values

bitenum.token: Transition to HFXTTARG values
bitenum.description: Transition to HFXTTARG values

bitenum.token: Injecting HFOSC for fast startup
bitenum.description: Injecting HFOSC for fast startup

bitenum.token: Second shutdown state
bitenum.description: Second shutdown state

bitenum.token: Starting LDO
bitenum.description: Starting LDO

bitenum.token: FSM in idle state
bitenum.description: FSM in idle state

bitfield.description: Current IDAC control value.
Current IREF control value.
Current Q2CAP control value.
Current Q1CAP control value.

HFXT control values match target values.
This applies to IREF, Q1CAP, Q2CAP values.
HFXT amplitude good

register.description: Initial values for HFXT ramping

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Amplitude threshold during HFXT ramping
Initial HFXT IDAC current
Initial HFXT IREF current
Initial HFXT Q2 cap trim
Initial HFXT Q1 cap trim

register.description: Target values for HFXT ramping

bitfield.description:
ADC hysteresis used during IDAC updates.
Every AMPCFG1.INTERVAL, IDAC will be regulated - up as long as ADC $lt; AMPTHR - down as long as ADC $gt; AMPTHR+AMPHYST
Minimum HFXT amplitude
Minimum IDAC current
Target HFXT IREF current
Target HFXT Q2 cap trim
Target HFXT Q1 cap trim

register.description:
Alternative target values for HFXT configuration
Software can change these values to dynamically transition the HFXT configuration while HFXT is running. Set SEL to select the alternative set of target values.

bitfield.description:
Select the dynamic configuration.
Amplitude ramping will always happen using the values in HFXTINIT, and HFXTTARG. Afterwards, this bit can be used to select between HFXTTARG and HFXTDYN. Hardware will ensure a smooth transition of analog control signals.

bitenum.token: Select configuration in HFXTDYN.
bitenum.description: Select configuration in HFXTDYN.

bitenum.token: Select configuration in HFXTTARG.
bitenum.description: Select configuration in HFXTTARG.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Minimum HFXT amplitude
Minimum IDAC current
Target HFXT IREF current
Target HFXT Q2 cap trim
Target HFXT Q1 cap trim

register.description: Amplitude Compensation Configuration 0

bitfield.description:
Q2CAP change delay.
Number of clock cycles to wait before changing Q2CAP by one step. Clock frequency defined in FSMRATE.

Q1CAP change delay.
Number of clock cycles to wait before changing Q1CAP by one step. Clock frequency defined in FSMRATE.

ADC and PEAKDET startup time.
Number of clock cycles to wait after enabling the PEAKDET and ADC before the first measurement. Clock frequency defined in FSMRATE.

LDO startup time.
Number of clock cycles to bypass the LDO resistors for faster startup. Clock frequency defined in FSMRATE.

Inject HFOSC for faster HFXT startup.
This value specifies the number of clock cycles to wait after injection is done. The clock speed is defined in FSMRATE.

Inject HFOSC for faster HFXT startup.
This value specifies the number of clock cycles the injection is enabled. The clock speed is defined in FSMRATE. Set to 0 to disable injection.

Update rate for the AMPCOMP update rate. Also affects the clock rate for the Amplitude ADC.
The update rate is 6MHz / (FSMRATE+1).

bitenum.token: 250 kHz
bitenum.description: 250 kHz

bitenum.token: 500 kHz
bitenum.description: 500 kHz

bitenum.token: 1 MHz
bitenum.description: 1 MHz

bitenum.token: 2 MHz
bitenum.description: 2 MHz

bitenum.token: 3 MHz
bitenum.description: 3 MHz

bitenum.token: 6 MHz
bitenum.description: 6 MHz

register.description: Amplitude Compensation Configuration 1

bitfield.description:
IDAC change delay.
Time to wait before changing IDAC by one step. This time needs to be long enough for the crystal to settle. The number of clock cycles to wait is IDACDLY$lt;$lt;4 + 15. Clock frequency defined in AMPCFG0.FSMRATE.

IREF change delay.
Number of clock cycles to wait before changing IREF by one step. Clock frequency defined in AMPCFG0.FSMRATE.
Lifetime of the amplitude ADC bias value. This value specifies the number of adjustment intervals, until the ADC bias value has to be measured again. Set to 0 to disable automatic bias measurements.

Interval for amplitude adjustments. Set to 0 to disable periodic adjustments.
This value specifies the number of clock cycles between adjustments. The clock speed is defined in AMPCFG0.FSMRATE.

register.description: Configuration Register for the Tracking Loop

bitfield.description: Initial value for the resistor fine trim
Number of error-updates using BOOST values, before using KI/KP
Proportional loop coefficient during BOOST
Integral loop coefficient during BOOST
Number of updates before HFOSC is considered "settled"
Out-of-range threshold
Proportional loop coefficient
Integral loop coefficient

register.description: WDT counter value register

bitfield.description:
Counter value.
A write to this field immediately starts (or restarts) the counter. It will count down from the written value. If the counter reaches 0, a reset will be generated. A write value of 0 immediately generates a reset.
This field is only writable if not locked. See WDTLOCK register. Writing this field will automatically activate the lock.
A read returns the current value of the counter.

register.description: WDT test mode register

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

WDT stall enable
This field is only writable if not locked. See WDTLOCK register.

bitenum.token:
ENABLE
WDT stops counting while the CPU is stopped by a debugger.
bitenum.description:
ENABLE
WDT stops counting while the CPU is stopped by a debugger.

bitenum.token:
DISABLE
WDT continues counting while the CPU is stopped by a debugger.
bitenum.description:
DISABLE
WDT continues counting while the CPU is stopped by a debugger.

register.description: WDT lock register

bitfield.description:
A write with value 0x1ACCE551 unlocks the watchdog registers for write access. A write with any other value locks the watchdog registers for write access. Writing the WDTCNT register will also lock the watchdog registers.
A read of this field returns the state of the lock (0=unlocked, 1=locked).
